intro: Sanicula marilandica var. canadensis, commonly known as Canadian sarsaparilla, is a perennial herb native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has a distinct, aromatic root that is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features include a rhizomatous root system and a branching stem with opposite leaves.
